image.altText: An aerial view of the Gold Coast canal network

props.synopsis: Home prices have risen by almost 50 per cent in the past five years, with more than a decade now needed to save for a standard 20 per cent deposit for houses in most capital cities, according to a new report.

title.children: Buying a home has never been less affordable, report finds

image.altText: Former FBI Director James Comey speaks to reporters on Capitol Hill.

props.synopsis: The criminal cases against two high-profile critics of Donald Trump — former FBI director James Comey and New York attorney-general Letitia James — are thrown out of court.

title.children: Breaking: Court dismisses criminal cases against Trump critics

image.altText: A composite of Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Vladimir Putin.

props.synopsis: A detailed look at the 28-point plan — as it has been reported — shows some very minor concessions to Russia. But it mostly contains all the same points that have always been made with more or less force by Moscow.

title.children: In the Ukraine peace plan, brutal equations are being considered

image.altText: Auctioneer gestures to the crowd in front of a house he is selling. The sky is blue and a large crowd gather to watch

props.synopsis: Amid global warnings of impending financial doom, APRA and the Reserve Bank are far more concerned about a home-grown bubble, one that's been taking in oxygen for almost three decades.

title.children: Forget Wall Street, bitcoin and AI. Here's a real Aussie bubble

image.altText: Colourful stalls of different crypto companies with many punters asking questions.

props.synopsis: It's been a wild ride for bitcoin traders in recent months and, after a weekend of crypto and blockchain enthusiasm at a Sydney convention, sceptics continue to flag the risks.

title.children: 'Contagion' fears surface as bitcoin crash unsettles financial markets

image.altText: A satellite image of Australia with a large mass of cloud at the top.

props.synopsis: Cyclone Fina has hit the coastline of far northern Western Australia as a category three system.

title.children: Cyclone Fina hits remote parts of WA

props.synopsis: New data shows some patients with serious mental health conditions have been waiting more than 23 hours for a bed in emergency departments.

title.children: Mental health patients' emergency waits surge again

image.altText: An older man with thinning grey hair wears a dark suit as he stands and speaks.

props.synopsis: Macarthur MP Mike Freelander believes the multi-partisan support for restricting gambling advertising means the reforms will "get there" eventually.

title.children: Gambling ad ban would pass parliament with conscience vote, Labor MP says

image.altText: Pauline Hanson wearing a burka walks out of the Senate with members of One Nation.

props.synopsis: The rare break in proceedings came after One Nation's Pauline Hanson strode into the chamber wearing a burka and then refused to leave after being slapped with a sanction.

title.children: Senate shut down for 1.5 hours after Pauline Hanson's burka stunt

image.altText: Donald Trump and Xi Jinping talk as they leave after a bilateral meeting in South Korea

props.synopsis: Chinese state media reported some of what was discussed in the phone call that took place on Monday, local time.

title.children: Taiwan's 'return to China' key to international order, Xi tells Trump

image.altText: A Ukrainian soldier in combat gear looking at the sky in a backyard.

props.synopsis: The US blindsided Kyiv and European countries with a 28-point peace plan last week, giving Ukraine until Thursday to agree to a framework to end Europe's deadliest war since World War Two.

title.children: US and Ukraine work on 'refined' plan to end war after European pushback

image.altText: Donald Trump places a hand on his chest.

props.synopsis: Trump cares little for alliances. So his presidency could well offer a priceless gift to Australia: a rare moment when national self-interest can eclipse sentiment.

title.children: Trump putting America first could be a priceless gift to Australia

image.altText: A girl holds on to a cardboard box labelled "GHF" while sitting on a cart

props.synopsis: More than 800 Palestinians died in the vicinity of Gaza Humanitarian Foundation aid sites after it took over the distribution of all supplies in the strip in May.

title.children: Controversial Israel and US-backed Gaza aid organisation closes

image.altText: A man wearing a suit speaks to someone out of frame against a black background

props.synopsis: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi is one of many to pay tribute to the icon of Indian cinema.

title.children: Bollywood superstar Dharmendra dies aged 89

image.altText: Marilyn Warren, who has short brown hair, poses for a photo wearing a cream blazer

props.synopsis: Marilyn Warren made history when she was appointed chief justice of the Supreme Court of Victoria, though she has never thought of herself as a trailblazer.

title.children: The court was full of 'old and crusty' men. Then Marilyn Warren arrived

props.synopsis: Every question has only two options, one is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

title.children: Try our new 50-50 quiz: Every question is an even chance

image.altText: Words reading "Artificial intelligence AI", miniature of robot and toy hand are pictured

props.synopsis: 'AI slop' refers to low-quality content created by generative AI which often contains errors and is not requested by the user, according to Macquarie.

title.children: Macquarie Dictionary names 'AI slop' as word of the year 2025

image.altText: Two bystanders look on at helicopter crash scene.

props.synopsis: First responders have recounted the "absolute chaos" after two Sea World helicopters crashed in 2023, killing four people.

title.children: Inquest hears of 'absolute chaos' after deadly Sea World helicopter crash

image.altText: a person sits at a desk looking at the new Bureau of Meteorology website

props.synopsis: The Bureau of the Meteorology's new chief executive has blamed a "miscommunication" for the furore that has erupted over a costly and controversial website redesign.

title.children: BOM boss reveals $96.5m website rebuild approved by Turnbull government

image.altText: A profile photo of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

props.synopsis: The designation is the latest measure in the Trump administration's escalating campaign to combat drug trafficking into the US.

title.children: US labels Maduro-tied Cartel de los Soles a terror organisation

image.altText: Jamaican musician Jimmy Cliff performs on stage.

props.synopsis: Cliff was known for singles You Can Get It If You Really Want It and Many Rivers To Cross, as well as for his cover of Johnny Nash's I Can See Clearly Now.

title.children: Jimmy Cliff,  legendary Jamaican singer and reggae music pioneer, dies at 81

image.altText: A man wearing a black jacket and face mask stands looking neutrally at something out of frame

props.synopsis: A court in Seoul ruled that Kim Nok-wan's crimes were so grave they warranted his "permanent isolation from society."

title.children: Man jailed for life in largest cybersex crime case in South Korea's history

image.altText: Ash Riddell holds her medal

props.synopsis: Runner-up to Adelaide's Ebony Marinoff last year, Riddell polled 23 votes to add the league's highest individual honour to her fifth All-Australian selection.

title.children: Kangaroos star Ash Riddell wins AFLW best and fairest award

image.altText: Soldiers attend to an injured troop in a metro tunnel.

props.synopsis: As European security threats grow, German soldiers carry out drills in metro stations to prepare for urban warfare.

title.children: Berlin prepares for 'worst-case' scenario with late-night metro warfare drills

image.altText: A huge, threatening-looking storm system over a city.

props.synopsis: Lightning, destructive winds and hail have hit large parts of the state, with more than 150,000 homes losing power.

title.children: More than 150,000 without power as 11cm hail falls in Qld

image.altText: NSW Police attend a fatal stabbing at Rouse Hill

props.synopsis: NSW Police said two young boys were at a reserve at Rouse Hill when they were approached by three other boys about 4:20pm on Monday.

title.children: 15yo boy charged with murder after teen dies in stabbing in Sydney

image.altText: A man types on a laptop computer which is resting on his lap. The background is lit with red light.

props.synopsis: Whether you're an employee counting down the days until your break, or an employer trying to keep a business open over Christmas — what are the rules about working these holidays?

title.children: Do I have to work over the holidays, or use up leave if my workplace shuts?

image.altText: EU Trade Commissioner Maroš Šefčovič seated for an interview.

props.synopsis: The European Union will ask the United States to establish a "steel union" of higher tariffs and tighter import restrictions — which could have knock-on effects in Australia's steel sector — at crucial talks in Brussels on Monday.

title.children: Why the EU moved to preference military hardware purchases from its members

image.altText: A man pushes a stretcher with a woman wrapped in an orange blanket into the back of an ambulance

props.synopsis: Temple staff in Thailand were shocked when the woman began knocking from the coffin.

title.children: Woman found alive in coffin at crematorium in Thailand

image.altText: Digitally blurred people leaning over the side of a rubber dinghy collecting bags from the ocean.

props.synopsis: Police charge the chief officer of an international livestock carrier and three others, after half a tonne of cocaine was found floating off Western Australia's coast.

title.children: Half tonne of cocaine retrieved from WA waters, as livestock vessel chief charged

image.altText: Four detainees with blurred faces on the roof of Banksia Hill Detention Centre filmed from a helicopter.

props.synopsis: A number of detainees have climbed onto the roof of Perth's youth detention centre, damaging sheeting and throwing projectiles.

title.children: Disturbance at Perth's Banksia Hill youth detention centre

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiling as she sits in front of a Christmas tree.

props.synopsis: The sister of the man accused of murdering Cairns woman Toyah Cordingley has told a court she has spoken to her brother "two or three times a week" since his extradition from India.

title.children: Family searched India for man accused of Toyah Cordingley murder, court hears

image.altText: A young person holding trans pride flag.

props.synopsis: New Zealand has become the latest country to halt access to puberty blockers for young people with gender dysphoria but are they following best health practice or an outlier?

title.children: NZ is halting access to puberty blockers. What about the rest of the world?

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt standing next to decorative desserts.

props.synopsis: Skye Gyngell was born in Sydney into a prominent broadcast family but made her mark globally as a "culinary visionary who influenced generations of chefs".

title.children: Tributes flow after Australian Michelin star chef Skye Gyngell dies

image.altText: Big red ship docked in water.

props.synopsis: The auditor-general who said Tasmania's ferry operator was operating while insolvent, has been told his comments were "causing real harm to the company and its stakeholders".

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania chair says it would be 'perverse' to let company go under
